main_definition: Taiwan is an island nation in East Asia, officially known as the Republic of China (ROC), located southeast of mainland China across the Taiwan Strait.

meanings_and_examples.example: Taiwan County is a historical administrative division now largely merged into other counties.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An idiomatic expression referring to the Chinese term 'Zhu Yuanzhi', which means 'true royal ancestor' and was associated with Taiwan during ancient times when it was called Formosa.
meanings_and_examples.example: The name 'Taiwan' is derived from Zhu Yuanzhi, who discovered the island in 1582.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A slang term used by some people to refer to Taiwanese cuisine
meanings_and_examples.example: I tried out a new dish at a local restaurant and it was delicious. It's definitely one of the best 'Taiwan' I've had in this city.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A colloquial expression meaning to be unfamiliar or not well-known
meanings_and_examples.example: 'That area is a bit of a Taiwan for me. Can you give me directions?'

meanings_and_examples.definition: The island itself, often referred to informally as 'Taiwan'
